snippet.title: Video game ratings system helps holiday gift givers
snippet.description:
* Celebrity endorsements, tournaments offering cash prizes and games featuring scantly-clad women are part of the norm in the video gaming industry today. Video games are all grownup, and much like the movies, have a ratings system to ensure little Johnny doesn't catch an eyeful of inappropriate action.
http://www.cnn.com/2003/TECH/11/26/hln.game.esrb.ratings/index.html

snippet.title: Does Facebook really care about you?
snippet.description:
* The ire and angst accompanying Facebook's most recent tweaks to its interface are truly astounding. The complaints rival the irritation of AOL's dial-up users back in the mid-'90s, who were getting too many busy signals when they tried to get online. The big difference, of course, is that AOL's users were paying customers. In the case of Facebook, ...
http://www.cnn.com/2011/09/22/opinion/rushkoff-facebook-changes/index.html

snippet.title: 5 reasons why the iPad was made to keep parents sane
snippet.description:
* Being a tech dad is a curse. We are always chasing the latest and greatest that tech minds are producing despite our economic status, how many kids we have or whether or not the CFO at home (the wife) will approve.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/TECH/gaming.gadgets/07/04/ipad.parents.sane.wired/index.html

snippet.title: Dr. Joyce Brothers: Assessing Gary Condit's truthfulness
snippet.description:
* Joyce Brothers has been a psychologist for more than 30 years. She writes a daily column, "Intimate Advice," which is syndicated worldwide, as well as several monthly magazine columns. Dr. Brothers joined the CNN.com chat room from New York on Friday, August 24, 2001.
http://www.cnn.com/2001/COMMUNITY/08/24/brothers.cnna/index.html

snippet.title: Avoid the 'back-to-school plague'
snippet.description:
* As a first-grade teacher, Julie Miller is exposed to a horrifying number of germs on a daily basis.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/08/15/health/avoid-school-germs/index.html

snippet.title: Does Botox affect the ability to parent?
snippet.description:
* TV personality Kelly Ripa recently told In Touch Weekly she uses Botox possibly as often as she trims her nails. She also said her kids are useful gauges for when it's time for a tune-up.
http://www.cnn.com/2012/09/20/living/botox-moms/index.html

snippet.title: Rehire the coach who cursed at his players
snippet.description:
* If you haven't heard the audio clip of high school football coach Shawn Abel going off, you need to take two minutes out of your life to do so.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/10/28/opinion/granderson-coach-rant/index.html

snippet.title: We need year-round school to compete globally
snippet.description:
* As a nation, either our kids are getting dumber or everyone else's are getting smarter. American 15-year-olds ranked 14th in reading, 17th in science and 25th in math in a study of students in 34 nations and nonnational regions.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/OPINION/05/10/granderson.yearround.school/index.html

snippet.title: Man serving life in 1957 cold case appeals his murder conviction
snippet.description:
* "Nostalgia" and flimsy evidence led to guilty verdicts in the nation's oldest cold case ever solved, according to the man serving a life sentence for kidnapping and murdering a neighbor's child in 1957.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/21/justice/oldest-cold-case-appeal/index.html

snippet.title: Top 5 moments at the MTV Movie Awards
snippet.description:
* The 2014 MTV Movie Awards in Los Angeles Sunday were filled with laughs, standout fashion and rocking musical performances.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/14/showbiz/tv/mtv-movie-awards-top-5-moments/index.html
